alert.note: Alert for East Carroll; Madison (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 4:31PM CDT until August 24 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern East Carroll Parish in northeastern Louisiana... Northwestern Madison Parish in northeastern Louisiana... * Until 630 PM CDT. * At 431 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen in the past 2 hours, with 5 to 9 inches having fallen in the past 48 hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tallulah, Tendal, Waverly, Mansford, Sondheimer, Omega and Richmond. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
